approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: The project aims to develop a portal/dashboard for the VKYC team to independently fetch V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements, eliminating the current manual request process to the IT data server team.
project_goals: Enable VKYC team leads and process managers to fetch V-KYC recordings directly.
Automate the retrieval of V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements.
Provide a centralized portal for accessing V-KYC recordings.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the VKYC team relies on manual requests to the IT data server team to obtain VKYC recordings stored on the LTF 'NFS(Network File System)' server for internal and external (Audit) requirements. This manual process is inefficient and time-consuming, creating a bottleneck for audit compliance and internal data access.

requirements.description: A portal/Dashboard shall be created for VKYC recording access.
Access to the portal shall be provided to VKYC Team Leads (TL) and Process Managers.
All approved PL-VKYC recordings shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings shall be searchable by date, month, and year.
Recordings shall be visible if searched by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file for bulk video recording requests.
The uploaded file for bulk requests shall contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
The accepted file formats for bulk upload shall be CSV or TXT.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk request.
The results of the bulk request shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
A 'Download All' option shall be available for the displayed bulk request results.
The tabular display of results shall implement pagination, showing only 10 records at a time.
The 'Download All' functionality for bulk requests shall download only 10 records at a time.
Clicking on a single LAN ID in the search results shall initiate the download of the corresponding recording.
The system should cross-check the V-KYC approved date for IT usage.

functional_requirements: Creation of a V-KYC recording access portal/dashboard.
Role-based access control for VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers.
Availability of all approved PL-VKYC recordings on the portal.
Ability to search recordings by date, month, and year.
Ability to search recordings by LAN ID.
Option to upload a file (Excel/text) for bulk video recording requests.
Validation of uploaded file for 2-50 LAN IDs.
Support for CSV/TXT file formats for bulk upload.
Backend API integration for processing bulk requests.
Display of bulk request results in a paginated tabular format (10 records per page).
Functionality to download all displayed records (10 at a time) from bulk request results.
Direct download of a single recording upon clicking its LAN ID.
Cross-checking V-KYC approved date for IT usage.
non_functional_requirements: The portal access shall be restricted to very limited users (only Team Leaders and Process Managers) for security.
The system should handle bulk download requests efficiently, processing 10 records at a time to manage load.
The system should be able to reliably retrieve recordings from the LTF 'NFS(Network File System)' server.

success_criteria: VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers can independently fetch V-KYC recordings via the new portal.
The portal provides access to all approved PL-VKYC cases.
Recordings can be searched by date, month, year, and LAN ID.
Bulk download functionality for up to 50 LAN IDs is available and functional.
The manual request process to the IT data server team for VKYC recordings is eliminated.
constraints: Scope is limited to 'All Approved PL-VKYC cases'.
Bulk upload file is limited to a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
Bulk download and table pagination are limited to 10 records at a time.
Access to the portal is restricted to VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers.
Recordings are stored on LTF 'NFS(Network File System)' server.
assumptions: V-KYC recordings are consistently available and correctly stored on the LTF 'NFS(Network File System)' server.
The backend API for processing recording requests is available or can be developed.
LAN IDs are unique identifiers for V-KYC cases.
The necessary infrastructure (server, network) for hosting the portal and accessing NFS is in place or will be provided.
risks: Data integrity issues if recordings are not correctly linked to LAN IDs.
Performance bottlenecks with large numbers of recordings or concurrent bulk downloads if not adequately designed.
Security vulnerabilities if access control and data protection are not robustly implemented.
Integration challenges with the existing NFS server or backend APIs.

domain_specific_details.V-KYC: Video Know Your Customer process, a method for customer identification.
domain_specific_details.PL-VKYC: Personal Loan VKYC cases, specific VKYC recordings related to personal loans.
domain_specific_details.LAN ID: A unique identifier used to identify a customer or case.
domain_specific_details.NFS (Network File System) server: The existing server where VKYC recordings are currently stored.
domain_specific_details.LTF: Likely refers to L&T Finance, the organization mentioned in the sample screen.

recommendations: Elaborate on non-functional requirements, including detailed security measures (beyond access control), performance metrics, scalability, and reliability.
Define error handling mechanisms for file uploads, API calls, and recording retrieval failures.
Clarify the exact behavior and user experience for the 'Download All' option when only 10 records are downloaded at a time, especially for larger bulk requests.
Consider adding requirements for audit trails or logging of portal usage for compliance purposes, even if direct 'reporting' is stated as NA.
Specify data retention policies for the recordings and how they relate to the portal's accessibility.

identified_gaps: Lack of detailed Non-Functional Requirements (e.g., specific performance targets, scalability needs, comprehensive security policies, disaster recovery).
No explicit requirements for error handling and user feedback in case of failures (e.g., file upload errors, API call failures, recording not found).
Absence of requirements for logging or audit trails of user activity on the new portal.
No definition of data retention policies for the recordings accessible via the portal.
Missing detailed UI/UX specifications beyond basic layout.
No mention of integration details with the NFS server or the backend API beyond 'trigger a call'.
No requirements for system monitoring or alerts.
No explicit testing strategy or environment requirements.
No mention of future enhancements or maintenance plan.
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct workshops with stakeholders to define comprehensive non-functional requirements.
Specify error handling scenarios and corresponding user notifications.
Define logging requirements for all user actions and system events on the portal for auditability.
Establish data retention and archival policies for V-KYC recordings.
Develop detailed wireframes and mockups for the portal's user interface.
Document API specifications and integration points with the NFS server.
Outline a testing strategy including User Acceptance Testing (UAT), performance testing, and security testing.
Plan for ongoing maintenance and support post-deployment.
